subject: Creativity
title: Hollywood's Creative Machine: How Movies Actually Get Made
description: Learn Hollywood's Creative Machine: How Movies Actually Get Made in one minute.

hook.text: The average Hollywood movie costs $65 million to make. Only 1 in 3 turns a profit.

buildup.text: Hollywood operates on portfolio theory: studios make many movies knowing most will lose money, because a few hits cover.

discovery.text: The franchise model changed everything. Marvel's 32 films average $960 million each.

twist.text: Streaming disrupted the model: Netflix spends $17 billion/year on content.

climax.text: The tension between creative risk and financial safety defines Hollywood. The safest choices (sequels) make money.

punchline.text: Hollywood's real creativity isn't on screen.

quiz.question: What fraction of Hollywood movies turn a profit?
